dashboard.select_client_prompt: Select a client from the list to view their progress.
dashboard.delete_client_confirm: Are you sure? This client will be deleted and measurements sent back to Inbox.
dashboard.no_data_client: This client has no assigned measurements yet.
dashboard.no_clients_created: You haven't created any clients yet

help.pwa_text: BodyMetrics is a Progressive Web App. Install it on your mobile/tablet ('Add to Home Screen') or PC ('+' icon in address bar) to use it full screen.
help.first_time_text: Before loading SD data, you need at least one client to associate measurements with. Go to the **Clients** tab and create your first profile. Then, load files into the **Inbox** and assign them to that or another client.
help.starting_requirements_text:
‚Ä¢ Modern browser (Chrome 80+, Firefox 75+, Safari 14+, Edge 80+)
‚Ä¢ SD card with Tanita BC-601/602 CSV files
‚Ä¢ Local storage space for database
‚Ä¢ Internet connection only for initial installation
help.starting_installation_text:
1. Open BodyMetrics in your browser
2. Look for the install icon in the address bar
3. On mobile: tap 'Add to Home Screen'
4. The app will behave like a native application
help.starting_first_steps_text:
1. Create your first client in the **Clients** tab
2. Insert the SD card into your computer
3. Load CSV files from the /TANITA/GRAPHV1/DATA/ folder
4. Assign measurements to corresponding clients
help.files_where_text:
Files must be in the folder: `/TANITA/GRAPHV1/DATA/` on the SD card.

Valid filename examples:
‚Ä¢ `20241209_0830.csv` (format: YYYYMMDD_HHMM)
‚Ä¢ `20241210_1530.csv`
‚Ä¢ `20241211_0900.csv`

Accepted extensions: `.csv` (plain text, comma delimited)
help.files_structure_text:
Each CSV file contains a single measurement with the following fields:

‚Ä¢ **Date and time** in DD/MM/YYYY HH:MM:SS format
‚Ä¢ **Gender** (1=Male, 2=Female)
‚Ä¢ **Age** in years
‚Ä¢ **Height** in cm
‚Ä¢ **Weight** in kg
‚Ä¢ **Body fat** in %
‚Ä¢ **Muscle mass** in kg
‚Ä¢ **Visceral fat** (level 1-59)
‚Ä¢ **Body water** in %
‚Ä¢ **Bone mass** in kg
‚Ä¢ **Metabolic age** in years
‚Ä¢ **DCI** (Daily Calorie Intake) in kcal
‚Ä¢ **Segmental data** (fat and muscle per limb)
help.files_troubleshooting_text:
**Common error:** 'No valid measurements found'
‚Ä¢ Verify files are in the DATA/ folder
‚Ä¢ Ensure they are Tanita CSV files (not modified)
‚Ä¢ Check date format is DD/MM/YYYY

**Error:** 'Corrupt file or wrong format'
‚Ä¢ Do not manually modify CSV files
‚Ä¢ Always use the original scale SD card
‚Ä¢ Avoid opening and saving with Excel (changes format)
help.clients_creation_text:
1. Go to the **Clients** tab
2. Enter a code or alias (e.g., CLI-001, John PR)
3. Click **Save**

**Privacy tip:** Use codes instead of real names. Keep a private data sheet with real correspondences.
help.clients_assignment_text:
1. Load CSV files into the **Inbox**
2. Search for the client in the search field
3. Assign each measurement to the corresponding client
4. Assigned measurements will appear in the client's history
help.clients_infinite_trick_text:
The scale only has 4 memory slots, but you can measure hundreds of people:

1. **REMOVE THE SD CARD** (Very important)
2. Hold down **SET**, select your 'wildcard' user (e.g., slot 4) and modify the data
3. At the end it will ask 'CLr?' (Clear?). Say **YES** (Don't worry, since the SD card is not inserted, nothing important gets deleted)
4. **INSERT THE SD CARD**, press the wildcard user button and take the measurement

The scale will save the new data to the file without deleting history.
help.interpretation_main_metrics_text:
**Body Fat (%):**
‚Ä¢ **Blue:** Low (Men <8%, Women <21%)
‚Ä¢ **Green:** Healthy (Men 8-20%, Women 21-33%)
‚Ä¢ **Yellow:** High (Men 21-25%, Women 34-39%)
‚Ä¢ **Red:** Very high (Men >25%, Women >39%)

**Visceral Fat (Level 1-59):**
‚Ä¢ **Green:** 1-12 (Healthy)
‚Ä¢ **Red:** 13+ (Excess)

**Metabolic Age:**
‚Ä¢ **Green:** ‚â§ Real age
‚Ä¢ **Yellow:** > Real age
help.interpretation_segmental_text:
The body map shows fat and muscle distribution by segments:

‚Ä¢ **Right/left arm:** Strength and symmetry
‚Ä¢ **Trunk:** Abdominal fat and core muscle mass
‚Ä¢ **Right/left leg:** Strength and balance

**Difference interpretation:**
‚Ä¢ Differences >2% between sides may indicate imbalances
‚Ä¢ Higher trunk fat suggests metabolic risk
‚Ä¢ Higher leg muscle indicates good athletic base
help.interpretation_health_states_text:
**Color traffic light:**
‚Ä¢ **Blue:** Values below healthy range
‚Ä¢ **Green:** Values within optimal range
‚Ä¢ **Yellow:** Values in attention zone
‚Ä¢ **Red:** Values in risk zone

Ranges vary by gender and age (see specific tables).
help.interpretation_export_text:
1. Select a client
2. Click the **Spreadsheet (CSV)** button
3. A file with European format will download:
   ‚Ä¢ Delimiter: semicolon (;)
   ‚Ä¢ Decimals: comma (,)
   ‚Ä¢ Encoding: UTF-8 with BOM
   ‚Ä¢ Compatible with Excel, LibreOffice, Google Sheets
help.security_local_data_text:
**What is stored:**
‚Ä¢ Client list (codes/aliases)
‚Ä¢ Client-measurement associations
‚Ä¢ Language and display preferences

**What is NOT stored:**
‚Ä¢ Measurement data (remains on SD card)
‚Ä¢ Personally identifiable information
‚Ä¢ Data on external servers
help.security_backups_text:
1. Go to **Settings > Download Backup**
2. Save the .json file in a safe place
3. Make backups regularly (weekly)
4. You can send the file to other devices
help.security_restoration_text:
1. Go to **Settings > Load Backup**
2. Select the .json backup file
3. Confirm restoration
4. All clients and associations will be recovered
help.troubleshooting_common_text:
**'Cannot load CSV files'**
‚Ä¢ Verify browser permissions
‚Ä¢ Try with another browser
‚Ä¢ Restart the application

**'Data not saving'**
‚Ä¢ Check local storage
‚Ä¢ Disable private/incognito mode
‚Ä¢ Update browser
help.troubleshooting_compatibility_text:
**Compatible browsers:**
‚Ä¢ Chrome 80+ (recommended)
‚Ä¢ Firefox 75+
‚Ä¢ Safari 14+
‚Ä¢ Edge 80+

**Devices:**
‚Ä¢ Windows 10/11, macOS 10.15+, Linux
‚Ä¢ iOS 14+, Android 8+
‚Ä¢ Tablets and desktop computers
help.troubleshooting_support_text:
**Help resources:**
‚Ä¢ Complete documentation on GitHub
‚Ä¢ Issues and questions in the repository
‚Ä¢ Developer community

**Known issues:**
‚Ä¢ Excel modifies CSV format (use LibreOffice)
‚Ä¢ Some antivirus blocks file access
‚Ä¢ Old browsers don't support PWA

welcome.title: Welcome to BodyMetrics
welcome.subtitle: Segmental Body Composition Analysis with total privacy.
welcome.guide_1_text: This app does NOT store measurement data from the scale. It only saves the **association** (link) between a measurement and a Client you have created. The actual data lives on your SD card.
welcome.guide_2_text: Every time you enter the application: 1. **Drag or load all SD files** into the Inbox. 2. **Assign** each new measurement to the corresponding client. (If you refresh or close the app, you will have to reload the files).
welcome.guide_3_text:
The scale only has 4 memory slots, but you can measure hundreds of people using this trick without deleting data:
1. **REMOVE THE SD CARD** (Very important).
2. Hold down **SET**, select your 'wildcard' user (e.g., slot 4) and modify the data.
3. At the end it will ask 'CLr?' (Clear?). Say **YES** (Don't worry, since the SD card is not inserted, nothing important gets deleted).
4. **INSERT THE SD CARD**, press the wildcard user button and take the measurement.
(The scale will save the new data to the file without deleting the history).
welcome.guide_4_text: You can delete clients or undo associations if you make a mistake. Use the **Spreadsheet** button inside each client to get a clean .CSV file, ready to use in any spreadsheet program (LibreOffice, Excel, Google Sheets, etc.) or to email.
welcome.guide_5_text: Your clients and associations with scale measurements are not saved on the internet, only in your device's browser. If you clear browser cache, uninstall the browser, or format the PC/device, you lose the list. Go to **Settings > Download Backup** regularly to avoid losing this data. This data can be downloaded and sent to other devices; go to **Settings > Load Backup** to restore your data.
welcome.guide_6_text: Transparent open-source project. You can review the code, contribute, or install it on your own offline local server.
welcome.cta: Start by creating your first client:
welcome.cta_import: Do you have a backup file (.json)?
welcome.privacy_hint: Tip: Use codes (e.g., CLI-001) or aliases (e.g., Juan PR) if you want maximum privacy. Keep the relationship between these codes or aliases and their real names in a private data sheet for more security.

about.title: About BodyMetrics
about.description: FOSS (Free and Open Source Software) application for secure and private segmental body composition analysis.
about.disclaimer: Independent project. Not affiliated with Tanita Corp.

upload.instruction_path: Look on your SD card for folder: /TANITA/GRAPHV1/DATA/
upload.drop_zone: Drag here all .CSV files from that folder
upload.browse: Or click to browse the SD card
upload.error: No valid measurements found. Please check for .CSV files in the DATA folder.

settings.title: Settings & Security
settings.backup_desc: The Client Database is saved locally in this browser. Download a .json backup regularly to prevent data loss if you clear cache or switch PCs.
settings.import_error: File does not look like a valid backup.
settings.delete_all_confirm: Are you sure? This will delete ALL client lists and assignments from this browser.

tooltips.traffic_light_description:
This traffic light shows body fat status according to standard ranges:

‚Ä¢ Blue: Low fat
‚Ä¢ Green: Healthy fat
‚Ä¢ Yellow: High fat
‚Ä¢ Red: Very high fat

Ranges vary by gender and age.
tooltips.measurement_card_description:
Cards change color based on health status:

‚Ä¢ Green: Healthy values
‚Ä¢ Yellow: High values
‚Ä¢ Red: Very high values
‚Ä¢ Blue: Low values

Based on standard bioimpedance ranges.
tooltips.visceral_fat_description:
Visceral fat is located inside the abdomen and surrounds internal organs.

Healthy range: 1-12
High values: 13+

Elevated levels increase health risk.
tooltips.metabolic_age_description:
Compares your metabolism to average chronological age.

‚Ä¢ Green: Metabolic age ‚â§ real age
‚Ä¢ Yellow: Metabolic age > real age

A younger metabolism is more efficient.

first_use.title: First Use Guide
first_use.step_inbox_description: Here you load CSV files from the Tanita scale SD card. Look in the /TANITA/GRAPHV1/DATA/ folder and drag all .CSV files here.
first_use.step_clients_description: Create and manage client profiles. You can use codes or aliases to maintain privacy. Assign measurements from the inbox to each client.
first_use.step_settings_description: Create backups of your local database and restore them when changing devices. You can also delete all data if needed.
first_use.step_help_description: Find detailed information about the application, usage instructions and links to the project source code.
